definition: all one's hopes and efforts come to nothing/futile
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
empty/air/sky/in vain
to empty/vacant/unoccupied/space/leisure/free time
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
pinyin: zhu2 lan2 da3 shui3 , yi1 chang2 kong1

sentences.english: His dream of being hired as an editor proved to be pie in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 他當編輯的夢想證明不過是竹籃打水一場空。

sentences.english: "play boxing without internal, you will get nothing".
After months of struggling it had clearly gotten to be a futile exercise.
sentences.chinese: 好幾個月的鬥爭換來的卻是竹籃打水一場空。

sentences.english: Two of her girls had been on the point of marriage, and after all there was nothing in it.
sentences.chinese: 兩個女兒本來快要出嫁了，到頭來只落得一場空。

sentences.english: You are drawing water with a sieve.
Finally, it is like drawing water with a sieve.
sentences.chinese: 到頭來，竹籃打水一場空。

sentences.english: It means that all the wealth in the world is nothing but a dream.
sentences.chinese: “南柯一夢”比喻世間榮華富貴不過是一場空夢。

sentences.english: Fucked with a Deadfish , I Realized that i was Confussed.
sentences.chinese: 明知道這只是一場空，還要不斷地麻醉自己。

definition: futile
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to work to no avail (idiom)
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
toil/hard work
predestined fate (Buddhism)
(of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
idle gossip
hard to explain in a few words (idiom); complicated and not easy to express succinctly
to force someone to do something
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
dangerous/ruthless/treacherous
to deceive/to cheat
